jhelp.util.thread

Class MessageHandler<MESSAGE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.util.thread.MessageHandler<MESSAGE>
  • Type Parameters:
    MESSAGE - Message type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MessageHandlerTest

    public abstract class MessageHandler<MESSAGE>
extends java.lang.Object
    Handler of messages.
    It reacts to messages posted for him.
    Its thread safe, that is to say, if 2 threads post a message in "same time", the messageArrived(Object) is called for one of them, then AFTER the code execution its done, its called again.
    In other words, messageArrived(Object) will never called in "same time". It also means, it waits that a message is completely manage (exit from messageArrived(Object)) before doing an other stuff
    You have to call terminate() when you need no more the handler
    Author:
    JHelp

      • cancelMessage

        public final void cancelMessage(MESSAGE message)
        Cancel a message.
        Usually used with message post with postDelayedMessage(Object, int) to cancel it before it is called.
        If the message already delivered, this method does nothing
        Can be used for timeout for example
        Parameters:
        message - Message to cancel

      • isAlive

        public final boolean isAlive()
        Indicates if the handler still alive and can be used

      • postMessage

        public final void postMessage(MESSAGE message)
        Post a message and deliver it as soon as possible
        Parameters:
        message - Message to post

      • terminate

        public final void terminate()
        Stop the handler and destroy it.
        It can't be used after the calling of this method.
        It is strongly recommend to call it as soon as the handler is not still necessary
